intro: Gigalobium scandens, commonly known as the climbing globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing or climbing habit, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive dark center, blooming from spring to summer. Gigalobium scandens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
